description.narrative: Preparing Third National Communication (TNC) and other new information to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Enhanced understanding of domestic mitigation actions and preparation of Biennial Update Reports for submission during 2014 2016 and 2018

A Biennial update of GHG inventory for the years 2010 and 2012
B Update of the national circumstances and institutional arrangements from BUR perspective for 2014 and 2016
C Mitigation actions and their effects until 2020 including associated assumptions methodologies and modeling
D Update on the technical financial capacity needs and support received for implementing these mitigation actions
E Biennial Update Reports BUR submitted in 2014 and 2016

comment.narrative:
A No previous reports other than SNC reporting GHG inventory for year 2000
B Only SNC report

E Only SNC

D BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018
E BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018

First Biennial Update report has been prepared and subjected to independent review After consideration of comments from experts the draft of first BUR was subjected to the Expert Advisory Committee on BUR that endorsed the document on 24 April 2015 with little changes The report was placed to the meeting of National Steering Committee on 30 April 2015 where the report was duly agreed upon for submission After taking NSC comments into consideration a revised draft was prepared along with the draft cabinet note which was approved by the minister The draft cabinet note and the draft BUR thus prepared has been circulated to ministries for comments and feedback After the comment period is over a final cabinet note will be placed for consideration of the cabinet After approval the BUR will be submitted to the UNFCCC

A BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018
B BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018
C BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018
D BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018
E BUR for 2014 2016 and 2018

First Biennial Update report has been prepared and subjected to independent review After consideration of comments from experts the draft of first BUR was subjected to the Expert Advisory Committee on BUR that endorsed the document on 24 April 2015 with little changes The report was placed to the meeting of National Steering Committee on 30 April 2015 where the report was duly agreed upon for submission After taking NSC comments into consideration a revised draft was prepared along with the draft cabinet note which was approved by the minister The draft cabinet note and the draft BUR thus prepared has been circulated to ministries for comments and feedback After the comment period is over a final cabinet note will be placed for consideration of the cabinet After approval the BUR will be submitted to the UNFCCC

description.narrative: Impacts and vulnerability assessments and adaptation measures

A Climate variability profiles trends prepared at national state level
B Climate change projections using latest CIMIP5 multiple GCM based outputs for different RCP scenarios at national state level
C Quantitative impacts of climate change using latest models for different sectors such as Water resource agriculture forest ecosystems health coastal zones etc
D Climate change vulnerability profiles developed at national state level for different sectors
E Adaptation matrix for coping with climate impacts for different sectors and different regions
F Adaptation framework and policies for mainstreaming developed

comment.narrative:
A No state level climate variability profiles available
B Climate change projections are available only for SRES A2 B2 A1B scenarios
C SNC presents climate impacts based on SRES scenarios
D Vulnerability profiles are not available for all the key sectors at national state level
E Preliminary adaptation practices presented in SNC for only agriculture and forest sectors
F No adaptation framework presented in SNC and no national state level adaptation framework policies exist for mainstreaming adaptation in different sectors

A Climate variability profiles and maps prepared at state level
B Climate change projections and maps prepared based on multiple model ensemble based on CIMIP5 RCP scenarios at GCM RCM grid scales Projections of extreme events made available
C Impacts of climate change on key sectors assessed using latest climate change projections for RCP scenarios and improved impact models
D Vulnerability profiles based on climatic biophysical socioeconomic factors developed
E Adaptation matrix developed for projected climate change impacts for different sectors at regional level and updated information for agriculture and forest sectors
F Policy framework developed for mainstreaming adaptation

The first activity for this outcome was the consultation with experts on Impacts and vulnerability assessments and adaptation measures A National Workshop on Climate Change Impacts Vulnerability and Adaptation was held in 2014
A second workshop is being planned in September 2015

A Climate variability profiles and maps prepared at state level

D Vulnerability profiles based on climatic biophysical socioeconomic factors developed
E Adaptation matrix developed for projected climate change impacts for different sectors at regional level and updated information for agriculture and forest sectors
F Policy framework developed for mainstreaming adaptation

The first activity for this outcome was the consultation with experts on Impacts and vulnerability assessments and adaptation measures A National Workshop on Climate Change Impacts Vulnerability and Adaptation was held in 2014
A second workshop is being planned in September 2015

description.narrative:
A Documentation and synthesis of national climate change policies
B GHG emissions scenarios for 2020 and 2030
C Mitigation potential of Energy and Land use sectors and projections for 2020 and 2030 based on modelling
D Mitigation action plans at national and state levels
E Constraints gaps and related technical financial and capacity needs
F TNA and technology transfer and financial needs

comment.narrative:
A No such analysis is available except a book published in 2004
B Ministry of Environment has published GHG emissions for 2030 which is outdated
CMitigation potential not reported in SNC but a few published papers available which are based on limited information
D No national mitigation plan available apart from a Low Carbon strategy prepared by the Planning Commission State level preliminary mitigation plans available for some states
E SNC
F SNC

A Climate change policy synthesis analysis and implications described
BImproved model based GHG emissions projections developed
CModel based mitigation potential estimates for energy and land use sectors along with marginal abatement cost curves developed
D Sectoral mitigation options developed at national state level along implications for GDP employment etc
E Gaps and constraints analyzed and barriers are ranked using AHP methods
F Detailed TNA and technology transfer and financial needs assessed
Information is being updated for the TNC First BUR is expected to present some of the initial findings

description.narrative: National GHG inventory prepared for the years 2011 2013 2014

A National GHG inventory for the sectors iEnergy iiIndustry iiiAgriculture ivLULUCF and vWaste for 2011 2013 2014 and trend analysis over 20002012
B IPCC 2006 guidelines AFLOU approach adopted
C Uncertainty of the GHG inventory estimation using Approach2 methods and reduction
D Emission factor database and activity database prepared
E QAQC procedures established
F National inventory management system for different sectors

B IPCC 2003 LULUCF guidelines methods used in SNC
C Uncertainty estimated using Tier 1 methods in SNC
D Book published on emission factors
E No previous experience
F No previous experience

A GHG inventory prepared for the 2011 2013 2014 and trend analysis over 20002012
B Activity data on emission factors generated for all sectors including AFLOU
C Uncertainty estimates provided in third NC
D Emission factors and activity database available
E QAQC systems established and operational
F Institutional arrangements for sustained inventory established and operational

A national workshop on National Inventory Management System was organized in July 2015 at New Delhi Around 75 experts from all sectors Energy Industrial Processes Agriculture Waste and Forestry participated

description.narrative: Other information relevant for the preparation of the TNC Comprehensive description of climate change research strategies for sustainable National Communication process and communicating climate change to public

B No quantitative estimates available in SNC
C No institutional arrangement for long term and sustained preparation of national communication process presented in SNC
D Limited stakeholder consultation during SNC and no programs for communicating climate change

description.narrative: 1. Update report on India's National Circumstances. 2. Prepare the Information of GHG inventory for India. 3. Increased accuracy of GHG inventory through the use of tier-III methodologies in multiple sectors. 4. Increase the accuracy of GHG inventory through the use of tier-III methodologies for most sectors. 5. Strengthened and streamlined National institutional structure for long term National GHG inventory and the estimation of GHG emissions. 6. Improve climate change projections with the use of advanced and updated Regional Climate Change models. 7. Make available and develop a clearer understanding of climate and socioeconomic scenarios for India. 8. Improve understanding of, and appropriate actions planned for addressing, vulnerability to climate change at different sectors and regions. 9. Increase understanding of Adaptation framework, measures and possible projects . 10. Increase understanding of GHG mitigation policies and measures at national and state level. 11. Increase understanding of gaps and constraints pertaining to financial, technical and capacity needs to address climate change. 12. Develop a Comprehensive description of systematic observations and research on climate change. 13. Enhance understanding of domestic mitigation actions, its need and the level/nature of support required, greenhouse gas emissions inventory and other related information.

comment.narrative: 1. National circumstances report available that needs to be updated. Additionally all the countries have been asked to develop an interim report (BUR) biennially to report on national circumstances and GHG inventory. 2. GHG inventory are available as part of second national communication to UNFCCC developed in 2010 and submitted to UNFCCC in 2012 3. The existing national circumstances need to updated as per UNFCCC guidelines with latest information on national circumstances, 4. GHG inventory available for 2004- 2010 needs updating 5. Limited capacity of the National Institutional structure 6. Climate projections and GHG inventories currently in use in the country outdated, newer technologies need to be introduced 7. 2010 report available needs updating 8. 0 9. 2010 adaptation framework available needs updating 10. Limited understanding of GHG mitigation policies 11. Limited understanding of Gaps pertaining to financial technical and financial needs 12. There a few research and analysis available however require deeper research 13. Limited understanding of domestic mitigation actions and support required

1. finalization and submission of the Third National Communication to the UNFCCC. 2. Undertake studies feeding into the National Circumstances chapter of the TNC report specific to the impacts on climate sensitive sectors due to consequences of COVID-19. 3. This is the last year of the project, therefore the project will focus on closing all ongoing contracts and undertaking Terminal Evaluation.

1. Draft of the Third National Communication completed. To be finalised by end of December 2021. 2. Undertaken 9 studies to develop the chapter of National Circumstances. 3. Activities related to Terminal Evaluation initiated, to be completed by end of December 2021.

1. Finalization and submission of second Biennial Update Report to United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) 2. Chapters of the Third National Communication to be drafted for the UNFCCC 3. Low carbon strategy paper draft chapters to be ready by the end of the year

1. Second Biennial Update Report finalised and submitted to United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) 2. Draft chapters of the Third National Communication on national circumstances and capacity needs assessment prepared 3. Low carbon strategy paper draft chapters ready

1. Finalization and submission of the Third National Communication and the Third Biennial update to the UNFCCC 2. Expanding and strengthening the capacities of key technical institutes (under TNC) to address the suggestions and comments received on BUR -2

1. Third Biennial Update Report (BUR) being finalised for submission to UNFCCC before 31st December, 2020 2. Key suggestions received during the ICA process of BUR 2 have been incorporated in BUR- 3 and Third National Communication to the United Nations Framework Convention for Climate Change (UNFCCC)
1. All 5 chapters for the third national communication to be reviewed 2. Low carbon strategy paper will be finalised and launched

1. Three chapters (National Circumstances, Mitigation and Finance Technology Capacity needs) have been reviewed. Two chapters (Greenhouse Gas Inventory-2016 and Impact Vulnerability Adaptation) are under preparation and will be reviewed in March 2020. 2. Low carbon strategy paper drafted and is being reviewed by technical experts. The strategy paper will be finalised and launched in February 2020.
